avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can be released easily. or in isolated cases naturally, in all aspects above approximately 2200 m.
Fresh and older wind slabs are to be critically assessed. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack indicate an unfavourable avalanche situation.
Caution is to be exercised in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry slab avalanches are possible on wind-loaded slopes.
Slight increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of warming, in particular on rocky sunny slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The current avalanche situation calls for defensive route selection.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In particular along the border between Valais and Italy 30 to 60 cm of snow fell in the last few days above approximately 1800 m. The new snow of last week is lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2000 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
The sometimes storm force wind has transported a lot of snow. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
At low altitude from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: The weather conditions will facilitate a slow strengthening of the snow drift accumulations.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can still be released on steep northeast, southeast and southwest facing slopes above approximately 2100 m.
Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack indicate the unfavourable bonding of the snowpack. Caution is to be exercised in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Avalanches can be released by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size.
Slight increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of warming, in particular on rocky sunny slopes, as well as at the base of rock walls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs along the border with France. Backcountry touring calls for careful route selection.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In particular along the border with France 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday above approximately 1800 m.
The new snow is lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2000 m. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
The sometimes strong wind has transported a lot of snow. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

tendency.highlights: The weather conditions will facilitate a gradual strengthening of the snow drift accumulations.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can be released on steep northeast, southeast and southwest facing slopes above approximately 2200 m. Caution is to be exercised in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, in particular along the border with France.
Isolated small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry slab avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs along the border with France.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some regions 10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last few days above approximately 1800 m. The sometimes storm force wind has transported a lot of snow. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Various wind slab layers are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.

Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year in all altitude zones.

tendency.highlights: The weather conditions will facilitate a gradual strengthening of the snow drift accumulations.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed in the last few days in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The small wind slabs can still be released in some cases especially on extremely steep shady slopes above approximately 2100 m.
Slight increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of warming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some regions 5 to 20 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell in the last few days above approximately 1800 m.
The wind was moderate to strong in the vicinity of peaks. In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. Also at intermediate and high altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are very rare. The small wind slabs of last week can still be released in some cases especially on extremely steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The old snowpack is faceted and weak.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Also at intermediate and high altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
